top_categories.workout_context: 11,900ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Leadville Trail 100 MTB's Singletrack, Gravel roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Leadville Trail 100 MTB's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
119ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Leadville Trail 100 MTB, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Leadville Trail 100 MTB, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
11,900ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Leadville Trail 100 MTB. Train it until it feels boring.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on mixed mountain terrain—singletrack, fire roads,. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.

race_overlay.heat: August in Leadville, Colorado can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Leadville Trail 100 MTB. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Leadville Trail 100 MTB’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Leadville Trail 100 MTB with 11,900ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. Starts at 10,200 feet elevation; Columbine summit at 12,600 feet.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Leadville Trail 100 MTB demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed mountain terrain—singletrack, fire roads, pavement at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: singletrack, gravel roads, paved sections. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 100 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on VO2max, Durability, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 100 miles of mixed mountain terrain—singletrack, fire roads, pavement in Leadville, Colorado.
